data.title: Jonah Hill is Proof That Blondes Really Do Have More Fun
data.meta_description: Hill sits down with Vanity Fair's Krista Smith to talk about collaborating with Gus Van Sant in "Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far on Foot."
data.text:
It's good to see you at Sundance,

Yeah, you too, good to see you always.

here with Gus Van Zant's movie,

which is, it's exciting to see him back

and with Joaquim, Rooney Mara,

the title of it is, let me get it right,

Don't Worry, He Won't Get Far On Foot,

but it's based on a true story?

(laughs) Yeah, Joaquim Phoenix plays this guy,

John Callahan, who was a friend of Gus's

and a very alternative, controversial cartoonist,

who was an alcoholic and becomes a paraplegic

and then my character gets him sober

and sort of walks him through the sobriety process

and it's very darkly funny

and emotional, sort of like the best of what you,

like when you have a Gus Van Sant movie,

very much, I think, a movie only he could make

and pull it off.

What was he like to work with?

He's incredible, I mean, he just is quiet,

he's a man of few words, Hm-mm.

but he is able to create this environment

with very little talking,

that just has this really emotional,

creative, you know, tone to it.

Hm-mm, and what do you like about your character?

This is maybe my favorite experience I've had,

acting in this movie, Really?

because I'm usually playing people,

that are so chaotic inside and stressed out

and you know, all these things going on internally

and this was someone, who was sort of

at the other end of that in their life,

who was helping other people deal with that

and he's such a, I mean, when you see the film,

he's such a easy, you know, free spirit,

kind of like peaceful guy, that I just was the happiest

I ever was playing this character,

plus I got to have long, blond hair

and blonds really do have a lot of fun,

Yeah. (laughs)

You've had such a cool career

and now you're doing a Netflix show too, I see,

with your Superbad co-star, Emma, you guys, Maniac?

Yeah, working with her after all these years

was a very interesting experience.

Really, how crazy.

We were like two little like, weepy, emo nerds,

because we were like, it was 10 years,

right before we started shooting,

it was 10 years since we made Superbad,

we've maintained a friendship all this time

and it was just crazy to see, for me to see

how, not that she wasn't amazing then,

but to see how someone, who's so talented grows in 10 years

and just how great she is

and it was just so nice to work with an old friend.

Hm-mm, I wanna know what movie did you direct?

I wrote and directed a movie called Mid '90s

and it'll come out this year,

Hopefully about the mid '90s?

It takes place in the mid '90s,

Mid '90s, okay.

but it's, I don't really wanna talk much about it,

'cause I'm hopefully gonna get it ready for Telluride,

[Krista] Oh great, okay.

it's, that's my dream

and it's with Scott Rudin and A24

and you meet people, who either have no expectations

or they have certain expectations

and so I just wanna show the film,

because it's pretty much,

I don't think it's gonna be anything like

what you might expect,

so I just want people to have the experience of watching it.

Do you think you will direct again?

Yeah, of course,

Yeah, you like it? Can't wait.

Yeah, yeah.

But it takes me four or five years to write something,

that actually means something to me,

Hm-mm. it's not like,

some high concept movie,

usually the shit I end up writing about takes a few years,

because it's usually processing some real emotions

or things that either happened to me,

or friends or just kind of reflecting

on a certain period of your life,

so it's not something I'll just bang out

another movie in like a year.

Hm-mm. Yeah.

That's incredible,

well it's great to see you, Jonah.

You too.

I always love seeing you in person and on screen,

all of that, Same with you.

looking very handsome, I like the beard, I like the hair,

That is very nice, Krista. I like it all.

I'm tempted to flirt back,

but also Yeah.

I'm just trying to be respectful,

'cause I know she's married, right?

Yeah, yeah. She's taken,

so you know, Yeah, alright.

I'm just gonna take the compliment

and just say thank you very much.

You're welcome very much.
